column4: Okay, so, sudo invoke etc...
Just put my computer at a black screen that said "reloading log daemon" and never did anything.
did you try pressing enter?
what about ctrl+alt+f1
er, ctrl+alt+f2
when gdm is stopped it usually dumps you to a system console
they select the active system terminal
X normally is attached to the one accessed with ctrl+alt+f7
to go to the second terminal instead of the first
in case the first one doesn't work
I usually use the second, but the first usually works
it's usually on tty7 (ctrl+alt+f7)
ctrl+alt+f7
if X isn't running, that won't work
it sounds like it may be a configuration issue
were you installing video drivers earlier?
I think it could be the driver itself causing it
were you using ubuntu's driver manager?
have you tried the recovery mode?
that won't stop X.  It just changes to a different terminal
no
but it likely will work in revobery mode
if that fails, try sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
